org.tigris.noodle
Interface NoodleConstants

public interface NoodleConstants

Field Summary
static java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_CHARSET
          This is used when dealing with charset headers; it is the modifier within the content-type header which specifies the charset.
static java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_HEADER_NAME
          The header used for HTTP content type
static java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_HTML
          The content type for HTML data.
static java.lang.String DEFAULT_CHARSET
          The default encoding to use when : (1) we are reading bytes into unicode characters (2) we cannot determine the encoding for those bytes due to a lack of information in the response When we use this, we won't use the DEFAULT_OUTPUT_CHARSET.
static java.lang.String DEFAULT_CONTENT_TYPE
          Used when no content type is set on the proxy return.
static java.lang.String DEFAULT_HOST
           
static java.lang.String DEFAULT_OUTPUT_CHARSET
          The default encoding to use when : (1) we have read bytes into unicode characters per response info (2) we are writing those unicode characters into bytes for output (3) we were able to guess an encoding based on the response http content type header or a meta HTML tag within the response Generally, we want this to be UTF-8 to avoid losing data.

CONTENT_TYPE_CHARSET

public static final java.lang.String CONTENT_TYPE_CHARSET
This is used when dealing with charset headers; it is the modifier within the content-type header which specifies the charset.

DEFAULT_OUTPUT_CHARSET

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_OUTPUT_CHARSET
The default encoding to use when : (1) we have read bytes into unicode characters per response info (2) we are writing those unicode characters into bytes for output (3) we were able to guess an encoding based on the response http content type header or a meta HTML tag within the response Generally, we want this to be UTF-8 to avoid losing data.

DEFAULT_CHARSET

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_CHARSET
The default encoding to use when : (1) we are reading bytes into unicode characters (2) we cannot determine the encoding for those bytes due to a lack of information in the response When we use this, we won't use the DEFAULT_OUTPUT_CHARSET.
